tool_description: Parses and structures drill hole data from various formats, extracting collar, survey, assay, and lithology information into standardized formats.

collar_file.description: Path to drill hole collar data file containing hole locations and metadata

survey_file.description: Path to downhole survey data file containing azimuth and dip measurements

assay_file.description: Path to assay data file containing sample grades and intervals

lithology_file.description: Path to lithology data file containing rock type information

coordinate_system.description: Coordinate reference system (e.g., UTM, local_grid, WGS84)

depth_units.description: Units for depth measurements: meters or feet

grade_elements.description: List of elements/commodities to extract from assay data

error_messages: Missing required files: Ensure collar_file, survey_file, and assay_file paths are valid and accessible.
Coordinate system not recognized: Use a standard coordinate system identifier or 'local_grid' for local coordinates.
Invalid depth units: Use either 'meters' or 'feet' for depth measurements.
Unsupported file format: Files must be in CSV, Excel, or compatible tabular format.
Data format mismatch: Files must contain the required columns for drill hole data parsing.
Empty grade elements: Provide at least one element symbol for grade extraction.
usage: Provide paths to collar, survey, and assay data files, specify the coordinate system and grade elements of interest. Optionally include lithology data and specify depth units. The tool returns structured drill hole data ready for analysis.

total_holes.description: Total number of drill holes processed

total_samples.description: Total number of assay samples processed

depth_range.description: Array containing minimum and maximum depths [min_depth, max_depth]

parsed_elements.description: List of successfully parsed grade elements

data_summary.description: Summary of parsed drill hole data including coverage and completeness
